commit_message:
Add a decorator decorator that checks func args

This patch adds a decorator for decorators that allows specifying the
arg names that the function being decorated must accept. If the function
being decorated does not accept the specified args, an exception will be
thrown during 'decoration', meaning import time usually.

If however the function accepts variable number of arguments, the
decorator will be a no-op as it is not possible to guess what will be
passed at runtime. This is however good enough for Nova's compute
manager decorators that inspired this work, as they decorate methods
with well defined and even versioned arguments.

Several decorators used in compute manager are now fortified with this
"compile time" check.

subject: Retry subnet delete until no ports are associated
commit_message:
Retry subnet delete until no ports are associated

The following resources are known to create a port on the "default"
subnet even when no subnet is explicitly identified in the resource
creation:
- OS::Nova::Server (by specifying a network)
- OS::Neutron::Port (by not specifying a subnet)
- OS::Neutron::RouterGateway (deprecated, but still)
- OS::Neutron::Router (by specifying router_gateway_info)

This causes races during stack delete since the subnet cannot be deleted
if there are still ports associated with it.

This change retries the subnet delete, and treats response 409 Conflict
as criteria for a retry rather than an error.

This change also removes the implicit dependencies added to Port and
RouterGateway. It also means that Server and Router do not need the
implicit dependency workaround added to them.

This change also future-proofs any other neutron resources which create
ports on unspecified subnets.

Change-Id: Idb8c8a86e7fd2cd9cb92a251cf16468f06648d92
Closes-Bug: #1243992
Closes-Bug: #1279645

subject: Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__
commit_message:
Cisco Nexus: maximum recursion error in ConnectionContext.__del__

If DevStack is configured for the Cisco Nexus plugin, the following
error is observed:

Exception RuntimeError: 'maximum recursion depth exceeded' in <bound
method ConnectionContext.__del__ of
<neutron.openstack.common.rpc.amqp.ConnectionContext object at
0x403a3d0>> ignored

The root cause of the problem is that the Cisco Nexus plugin's
PluginV2.__gettattr__ method, a model object is being passed
as a value for a unicode %s format mod. Because the neutron server
has "lazy gettext" (deferred interpretation of unicode objects) enabled,
this causes many layers of recursive calls to deepcopy.

The fix is to pass a string object for the unicode %s mod field.

subject: Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone
commit_message:
Add support for parallel testr workers in Keystone

Full support for parallel testr workers now works in keystone. The
major item to be aware of is that if non-SQLite backends or a LIVE
LDAP backend is being used for testing, the concurrency must be set
to 1 to avoid conflicts. To artificially set the concurrency set
the env variable ``TEST_RUN_CONCURRENCY`` to the desired number of
testr workers. The default is to run one worker. To use 1 per
available core, set ``TEST_RUN_CONCURRENCY`` to 0.

Each worker uses a subdirectory of the test temp dir  based upon
the PID. When the worker exists (via the use of atexit), the
worker-specific PID directory is automatically removed.

The first time concurrent tests are run in a given environment,
ensure that old .testrepository directories are cleaned up as they
may introduce bad learning data on how to bin the tests based upon
test runs that occured without concurrency.

Closes-Bug: #1240052

subject: Fixed issue with parrallel tests execution
commit_message:
Fixed issue with parrallel tests execution

When user runs several types of OSTF tests, these tests can be run
in parallel and in the result tearDown method deletes all environment
and some tests will fail. To avoid this we will generate new name
for each new environment and we should also delete only this environment
in tearDown method.
